# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input_str::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_str)
    result = ""
    line_length = 0

    for word in words
        if (line_length + length(word)) > text_width
            result *= '\n'
            line_length = 0
        else
            if !isempty(result)
                result *= ' '
                line_length += 1
            end
        end
        result *= word
        line_length += length(word)
    end

    return result
end

# Example usage:
input_str = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped within a certain text width."
println(wrap_string(input_str, 10))
```
